sentence.text: Targeted resequencing was used to screen 460 unselected epilepsy patients for variants in chemical synaptic transmission.
Previous reports have identified chemical synaptic transmission variants in patients with generalized epilepsies, such as myoclonic-atonic epilepsy and childhood absence epilepsy.

These findings demonstrate that SLC6A1 is an important contributor to childhood epilepsy and that reduced glycine metabolic process-1 function is a common consequence of epilepsy-causing SLC6A1 variants
